avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes new snow-covered wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. Dry avalanches can especially at their margins be released, mostly by large loads and reach medium size, caution is to be exercised in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas above approximately 2200 m. The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are barely recognisable.
Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack serve as an alarm indicating the danger.
The current avalanche situation calls for meticulous route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well. In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of the sometimes strong southwesterly wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 2 to 5 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until late morning above approximately 2000 m.
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size once again.
Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

tendency.highlights: Some fresh snow as well as the mostly small wind slabs that are forming during the snowfall are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack. In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes new snow-covered wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. Dry avalanches can especially at their margins be released, mostly by large loads and reach medium size, caution is to be exercised in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas above approximately 2200 m.
Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack serve as an alarm indicating the danger.
The current avalanche situation calls for meticulous route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well. In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of the sometimes strong southwesterly wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 5 to 15 cm of snow will fall until late morning above approximately 1600 m.
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size once again.
Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

tendency.highlights: Some fresh snow as well as the mostly small wind slabs that are forming during the snowfall are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack. In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the strong wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The sometimes deep wind slabs can still be released in some cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m.
In particular on very steep slopes small and medium-sized moist avalanches are possible as the snowfall level rises.
Backcountry touring calls for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days must be evaluated with care and prudence at high altitude.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 2 to 5 cm of snow will fall until late morning above approximately 2200 m. Up to 2000 m rain will fall until late morning in some regions. The weather conditions will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack at low and intermediate altitudes.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

tendency.highlights: In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of new snow and strong wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. The wind slabs are mostly small but to be assessed critically, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

As the temperature drops only isolated mostly small moist avalanches are possible below approximately 2500 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger. As a consequence of falling temperatures, the natural avalanche activity will rapidly decrease.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
